intro: Dyschoriste linearis var. decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent linear dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and slender, linear leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
